snippet: French nationals in the United States and in Canada will soon elect a deputy to represent them in the National Assembly of France, and in New York, the campaigning has taken on a distinctly local feel.
abstract: French nationals in the United States and in Canada will soon elect a deputy to represent them in the National Assembly of France; in New York City, where the race has become a contest between plucky newcomer Corinne Narassiguin and and political insider Frederic Lefebvre, the campaigns have taken on a distinctly local feel.
lead_paragraph: French nationals in the United States and in Canada will soon elect a deputy to represent them in the National Assembly of France, and in New York, the campaigning has taken on a distinctly local feel.

headline.seo: In New York City, French Politics Is Local
headline.main: In New York, French Politics Is Local
headline.print_headline: In New York, French Politics Is Local
